description: A budget doesn’t hamper our Frugal Traveler on a romp through downtown, from a beloved West Village cheese shop to the top of the city’s tallest tower.
title: A $1,000 Day in New York City for $100
title_page: A $1,000 Day in New York City for $100 - The New York Times
text:
The cozily elegant drawing room of Robert De Niro’s Greenwich Hotel in TriBeCa is for guests only. And considering that the most popular guest room, the “superior Greenwich” goes for $775 plus tax, it’s not the place a budget traveler would normally find himself relaxing in a leather chair as a concierge offered suggestions on fine French dining and private museum tours. In fact, the tax alone, $117.81, is itself more than the cost of 99 percent of places I’ve stayed as the Frugal Traveler columnist.
But there I was one day last month, listening to Kayla Passons describe a $1,000 day in New York City that she had concocted at my request. Ms. Passons restricted her agenda to downtown Manhattan, defined as 14th Street and below. “You don’t have to go to Times Square to experience the city,” she said, preaching to a one-person choir. “Everything you can find in Midtown, you can find down here.”
I set out to prove her right, but on a budget more suited to my tastes.
